alert.note: Alert for Corson; Dewey; Walworth (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 18 at 5:01PM MST until January 19 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST /5 AM MST/ FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST /8 AM MST/ FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph could reduce visibility in blowing snow to one half mile or less at times. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Corson, Walworth and Dewey Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM CST /5 AM MST/ Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 9 AM CST /8 AM MST/ Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility at times tonight. The hazardous conditions will impact the commute this evening and possibly in the morning. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
